alert.note: Alert for Amelia (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 1:19PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Amelia County through 145 PM EDT... At 119 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Jetersville, or near Amelia Courthouse, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Amelia Courthouse, Chula, Jetersville, Morven, Scotts Fork, Paineville, Maplewood, Earls, Lodore, Truxillo, Denaro and Winterham. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.
